title: 107_hr2558
content: The Act titled "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" allows for voluntary early retirement incentive plans for governmental and higher education employees. Amendment to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act allows voluntary early retirement plans for educational agency and higher education employees to provide reduced or eliminated benefits based on age at retirement, as long as other benefits are not affected by age. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows employers to reduce or eliminate supplemental benefits based on an employee's age at retirement, as long as other benefits are not affected by age and the supplemental benefits are in addition to any retirement or severance benefits offered within the past year. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows employees to elect to retire with a 180-day window, without requiring retirement to occur sooner. Employees not eligible for maximum benefits due to age must be given a reasonable opportunity to retire. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows employees to retire within 180 days of election without being forced to retire sooner. Employees ineligible for full benefits due to age must have had a previous opportunity to receive maximum benefits. The amendment applies to voluntary employee early retirement plans in local educational agencies. The amendment to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 applies to voluntary employee early retirement plans in local educational agencies and institutions of higher education to determine compliance with age discrimination laws after January 1, 1996. SEC. 3. Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. Voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies are amended to be deemed as defined benefit plans for coordination with a defined benefit plan maintained by a state or agency. Retiree medical benefits are also coordinated with Medicare benefits under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies as defined benefit plans. Retiree medical benefits are coordinated with Medicare benefits under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967. The Employment Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 provides for medical benefits for retired participants, which may be affected if the participant is eligible for medical benefits under the Social Security Act or an employee benefit plan. The amendments apply to determine violations of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act for early retirement plans maintained by local educational agencies or employee benefit plans. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 may be violated by a defined benefit plan providing medical benefits for retired participants, as per the Employment Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The amendments do not infer whether a voluntary early retirement incentive plan maintained by a local educational agency constitutes a defined benefit plan for any purpose.
